channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree affecting neighbours property, 27th October
item.description:
I have a tree at the end of my garden that is hanging onto the roof of my neighbour. It’s blocking his view and causing problems for him resulting in tension. I looked it up and it says this is a conservation area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal parking! Abandoned vehicle since August 2025, 27th October
item.description:
Illegal parking! Abandoned vehicle since August 2025! Blocking the pavement and access to the building!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Elmfield Way, Maida Hill, London

item.title: Ongoing Rubbish Issue on Our Street, 27th October
item.description:
Ongoing issues with rubbish being left out after scheduled collections. Damaged bags are left for days, spilling litter into our garden and doorway. We follow the council’s waste schedule, but neighbours use our front path as a dumping ground.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenworthy Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 naseby close, 27th October
item.description:
There are 4 street lights that do not work on Naseby Close. For the security of the residents we would like to have them repaired.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Naseby Close, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunk ground, 27th October
item.description:
Some work was carried out outside our house two weeks ago or so, and we have reported issues with sunken ground and broken drains just outside our property to Bromley Council in the past. We now have sunken ground in our driveway which is damaging it, and we are also seriously concerned there may be a sinkhole or similar developing as a result of the council work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple items of furniture dumped, 27th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33 - 49, Farwig Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbished dumped in middle of parking bay opposite 36 Hamilton Terrace, NW8, 27th October
item.description:
The rubbish has been dumped since Friday 24th in the parking bay opposite 36 Hamilton Terrace. The road sweepers have not removed it either and given the current road works and restricted parking on Hamilton Terrace, it is difficult to find parking

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Hamilton Terrace, St. John's Wood, London

item.title: Litter on bridge, 27th October
item.description:
The litter and rubbish has not been cleared for week on the bridge here and along the west side. The spaces above the bridge piers are full of leaves and litter. Please clear! Thanks

item.title: Pot hole in the middle of the road, 27th October
item.description:
It is small in diameter but fairly deep so could be dangerous to cyclists. It is also in the middle of the road so you have to swerve to avoid it. I think it may be a pothole that has previously been filled that has opened up again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Salisbury Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
